intro: Ventilago zhengdei, commonly known as the Guangdong velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
